module.name: Menus
module.short: Menus to be used in Forms created with the Lazarus IDE

element.name: TMenu
element.short: TMenu - a menu appearing in a form. Base class for TMainMenu or TPopupMenu

descr.p: TMenu : The base class for all menus

The class definition contains very few public or published properties or methods accessible to the application programmer, but contains the entry Items which points to the Menu Items that appear in the menu displays

element.name: EMenuError
element.short:
EMenuError
- Exception handler for error in Menu access

element.name: TMenuChangeEvent
element.short: TMenuChangeEvent - generic event handling procedure for a change in a menu

element.name: TMenuActionLink
element.short: TMenuActionLink: defines the link between a selected menu item and its corresponding action

descr.p: TMenuActionLink defines the link between a selected menu item and its corresponding action. Properties are protected and not readily accessible by application programmers.

element.name: TMenuActionLink.FClient
element.short: FClient - local variable holding the MenuItem to which this action link applies

element.name: TMenuActionLink.IsAutoCheckLinked
element.short: IsAutoCheckLinked - returns True if the client's AutoCheck property is linked

element.name: TMenuActionLink.IsOnExecuteLinked
element.descr: IsOnExecuteLinked always returns true in TBasicActionLink. Descendent classes can override this method to provide a different result.

element.name: TMenuActionLink.SetAutoCheck
element.short: SetAutoCheck - specifies whether AutoCheck is to apply

element.name: TMenuActionLink.SetCaption
element.short: SetCaption - specifies the caption for the linked MenuItem

element.name: TMenuActionLink.SetChecked
element.short: SetChecked - specifies whether the Item is checked

element.name: TMenuActionLink.SetEnabled
element.short: SetEnabled - specifies whether the action is enabled

element.name: TMenuActionLink.SetHelpContext
element.short: SetHelpContext - specifies the Help context

element.name: TMenuActionLink.SetHint
element.short: SetHint - specifies the Hint string

element.name: TMenuActionLink.SetImageIndex
element.short: SetImageIndex - specifies the index of the associated image

element.name: TMenuActionLink.SetShortCut
element.short: SetShortCut - specifies the ShortCut for the Item and action

element.name: TMenuActionLink.SetVisible
element.short: SetVisible - specifies if item is to be visible

element.name: TMenuActionLinkClass
element.short: TMenuActionLinkClass - class of TMenuActionLink

element.name: TMenuItem
element.short:
TMenuItem
- The base structure of each item in a Menu.

descr.p:
TMenuItem
- The base structure of each item in a Menu.

This Component does the hard work of processing the Items found in the various types of menus. It defines a lot of the properties and methods used in the various sorts of menu, including TMainMenu, TMenu and TPopUpMenu

element.name: TMenuItem.ActionChange
element.short: ActionChange - changes the action associated with this menu item to a new action
element.descr: ActionChange - changes the action associated with this menu item to a new action, provided Sender is of type TCustomAction

element.name: TMenuItem.GetAction
element.short: GetAction - find the action associated with this menu item

element.name: TMenuItem.GetActionLinkClass
element.short: GetActionLinkClass - find out what class of action link is associated with this menu item

element.name: TMenuItem.GetHandle
element.short: GetHandle - get the operating system handle for the menu to which this item belongs

element.name: TMenuItem.DoClicked
element.short: DoClicked - process the system message signifying that a click has ocurred over this menu item

element.name: TMenuItem.CreateHandle
element.short: CreateHandle - create an operating system handle for this item

element.name: TMenuItem.DestroyHandle
element.short: DestroyHandle - destroy the operating system handle and free space on the heap

element.name: TMenuItem.InitiateActions
element.short: InitiateActions - start the initiation phase of the actions associated with the menu item

element.name: TMenuItem.MenuChanged
element.short: MenuChanged - rebuild it if True

element.name: TMenuItem.SetAction
element.short: SetAction - setup a new action associated with the menu item

element.name: TMenuItem.SetGroupIndex
element.short: SetGroupIndex - write the index value for group to this item belongs (may write a new group)

element.name: TMenuItem.SetImageIndex
element.short: SetImageIndex - gives the item an index value for its associated image

element.name: TMenuItem.SetShortCut
element.short: SetShortCut - sets up the keyboard shortcut for this item

element.name: TMenuItem.SetVisible
element.short: SetVisible - sets up whether the item is to be visible

element.name: TMenuItem.UpdateImages
element.short: UpdateImages - update all images associated with the item

element.name: TMenuItem.ImageListChange
element.short: ImageListChange - change the image list if commanded by the Sender

element.name: TMenuItem.ActionLink
element.short: ActionLink - a link to the action for this menu item

element.name: TMenuItem.FCompStyle
element.short: FCompStyle - local variable holding value of CompStyle

element.name: TMenuItem.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TMenuItem: calls inherited Create then intialises a large number of local variables

element.name: TMenuItem.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TMenuItem: releases bitmaps, handles, imagelists, actionlinks and parent controls, then calls inherited Destroy and

element.name: TMenuItem.GetImageList
element.short: GetImageList - Get the list of images for this menu, from which the image for the current item will be selected

element.name: TMenuItem.GetParentMenu
element.short: GetParentMenu - returns the parent menu to which this menu item belongs

element.name: TMenuItem.HandleAllocated
element.short: HandleAllocated - has an operating system handle been allocated?

element.name: TMenuItem.HasIcon
element.short: HasIcon - is there an icon associated with this menu item?

element.name: TMenuItem.InitiateAction
element.short: InitiateAction - start th einitiation phase of an action associated with the menu item

element.name: TMenuItem.IndexOf
element.short: IndexOf - the index value of this item

element.name: TMenuItem.IndexOfCaption
element.short: IndexOfCaption - the index value of the caption for this item

element.name: TMenuItem.VisibleIndexOf
element.short: VisibleIndexOf - the index of this item within the list of visible items

element.name: TMenuItem.IsCheckItem
element.short: IsCheckItem - is there a check-box associated with this item?

element.name: TMenuItem.Add
element.short: Add - an item to the menu

element.name: TMenuItem.AddSeparator
element.short: AddSeparator (a line) to the menu

element.name: TMenuItem.Click
element.short: Click - simulate the OnClick event

element.name: TMenuItem.Delete
element.short: Delete this item from the menu

element.name: TMenuItem.HandleNeeded
element.short: HandleNeeded - tell the operating system that a handle is needed for this item

element.name: TMenuItem.Insert
element.short: Insert a new item at the location marked by Index

element.name: TMenuItem.RecreateHandle
element.short: RecreateHandle from the operating system

element.name: TMenuItem.Remove
element.short: Remove this item from the menu

element.name: TMenuItem.IsInMenuBar
element.short: IsInMenuBar - this item appears in the main menu bar

element.name: TMenuItem.Clear
element.short: Clear - removes the contents of the item, but leaves the item in place

element.name: TMenuItem.HasBitmap
element.short: HasBitmap - determines whether there is a Bitmap for this item

element.name: TMenuItem.GetIconSize
element.short: GetIconSize - finds the size of the icon for this item

element.name: TMenuItem.Count
element.short: Count - number of items

element.name: TMenuItem.Handle
element.short: Handle - the operating system handle for this item

element.name: TMenuItem.Items
element.short: Items - the indexed list of menu items to which this item belongs

element.name: TMenuItem.MenuIndex
element.short: MenuIndex - the index value of the menu to which this item belongs

element.name: TMenuItem.Parent
element.short: The Parent MenuItem from which this item is derived

element.name: TMenuItem.Command
element.short: Command - the entry from the Command list to which this item refers

element.name: TMenuItem.MenuVisibleIndex
element.short: MenuVisibleIndex - the index value of the visible menu

element.name: TMenuItem.Action
element.short:
Action
- the default action associated with this Menu Item

element.name: TMenuItem.AutoCheck
element.short:
AutoCheck
: Whether a check mark is automatically added when the item is selected

element.name: TMenuItem.Caption
element.short:
Caption
: The text that appears on the Menu Bar at run-time

element.name: TMenuItem.Checked
element.short:
Checked
: whether a check mark appears on the Menu Bar

element.name: TMenuItem.Default
element.short:
Default
: is this option the default selection? If so, it usually appears in Bold and is selected by hitting ENTER

element.name: TMenuItem.Enabled
element.short:
Enabled
: can this option be selected? If Not Enabled, usually 'greyed-out'

element.name: TMenuItem.Bitmap
element.short:
BitMap
: an optional picture beside the MenuItem Caption

element.name: TMenuItem.GroupIndex
element.short:
GroupIndex
: the sequence number in a group of mutually exclusive RadioItem choices

element.name: TMenuItem.HelpContext
element.short:
HelpContext
- an index to the context-sensitive help string to be used

element.name: TMenuItem.Hint
element.short:
Hint
: a pop-up help message that appears when the mouse hovers over an item.

element.name: TMenuItem.ImageIndex
element.short:
ImageIndex
- number in a list of images for use in illustrating menu items

element.name: TMenuItem.RadioItem
element.short:
RadioItem
: whether the item is part of a group of mutually exclusive choices.

element.name: TMenuItem.RightJustify
element.short:
RightJustify
: the position of the Caption in the Menu Panel. Default (False) is Left Justify

element.name: TMenuItem.ShortCut
element.short:
ShortCut
- the quick key sequence to be used in selecting this menu item

descr.p:
ShortCut
- the quick key sequence to be used in selecting this menu item

If you select this property in the Object Inspector, a list-box will appear with choices for various key-combinations to be used. The chosen key-sequence will be displayed, at run-time, on the menu drop-down next to the caption for the menu item.

element.name: TMenuItem.ShowAlwaysCheckable
element.short: ShowAlwaysCheckable - if True, Item is always shown as checkable

element.name: TMenuItem.SubMenuImages
element.short:
SubMenuImages
- will images be shown for sub-menu items as well as the main item?

element.name: TMenuItem.Visible
element.short:
Visible
- can the item be seen?

element.name: TMenuItem.OnClick
element.short:
OnClick
- event handler for selection of this menu item

element.name: TFindItemKind
element.short: TFindItemKind - enumerated type for kind of item in search operation: a command, a handle or a shortcut

element.name: TMenu
element.short:
TMenu
: The base class for all menus

descr.p:
TMenu
: The base class for all menus

The class definition contains very few public or published properties or methods accessible to the application programmer, but contains the entry Items which points to the Menu Items that appear in the menu displays

element.name: TMenu.CreateHandle
element.short: CreateHandle - method for creating handle

element.name: TMenu.DoChange
element.short: DoChange - perform the OnChange event, completely rebuilding the Source menuitem if Rebuild is true

element.name: TMenu.GetHandle
element.short: GetHandle - returns the handle for this Menu

element.name: TMenu.MenuChanged
element.short: MenuChanged - method to signal that a menu has been changed

element.name: TMenu.OnChange
element.short: OnChange - event handler for a change to the menu

element.name: TMenu.UpdateItems
element.short: UpdateItems - implement all pending changes to Items

element.name: TMenu.FCompStyle
element.short: FCompStyle - local variable holding value of CompStyle

element.name: TMenu.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TMenu: creates menuitems and links, sets some defaults then calls inherited Create

element.name: TMenu.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TMenu: frees items and links, then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TMenu.DestroyHandle
element.short: DestroyHandle - method for destroying handle

element.name: TMenu.FindItem
element.short: FindItem - returns the menuitem corresponding to the supplied value or kind

element.name: TMenu.HandleAllocated
element.short: HandleAllocated - returns True if a handle has been allocated

element.name: TMenu.IsRightToLeft
element.short: IsRightToLeft - returns True if Right to Left mode is being used (eg for Hebrew or Arabic languages)

element.name: TMenu.HandleNeeded
element.short: HandleNeeded - method to signal that a handle is required

element.name: TMenu.DispatchCommand
element.short: DispatchCommand - returns True if the supplied command is a dispatch command

element.name: TMenu.Handle
element.short: Handle - the Operating System Handle for this Menu

element.name: TMenu.Parent
element.short: The Parent component for this Menu

element.name: TMenu.Items
element.short:
Items
- a list of Menu Items to be included in the menu display

element.name: TMenu.Images
element.short:
Images
- a list of images from which entries can be selected to illustrate menu choices

element.name: TMainMenu
element.short:
TMainMenu
- the Main Menu that appears at the top of most windows

descr.p:
TMainMenu
- the Main Menu that appears at the top of most windows; form designers can customise by choosing various menu items.

Main Menu is a non-visible component : that is, if the icon is selected from the Component Pallete and placed on the Form, it will not appear at Run-time. Instead, a Menu bar with a structure defined by the Menu Editor will appear.
To see the Menu Editor, right-click on the Main Menu icon on your Form.

element.name: TMainMenu.ItemChanged
element.short: ItemChanged - method to deal with a changed Item

element.name: TMainMenu.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TMainMenu: sets style to MainMenu then calls inherited Create

element.name: TMainMenu.OnChange
element.short: OnChange - event handler for a change in the Menu

element.name: TPopupMenu
element.short:
TPopupMenu
- a menu panel that pops up on the desktop when the right mouse button is clicked

descr.p:
TPopupMenu
: a menu panel that pops up on the desktop when the right mouse button is clicked.
Inherits all the properties of TMenu (including the properties of TMenuItem), but has some new properties (procedure PopUp and procedure Close) that define its behaviour when actually invoked.
PopupPoint defines the position of the Popup menu, usually at the current cursor position.

To use a Popup menu, first create it with the MenuEditor. Then with the Object Inspector for the control that needs to use the Popup, select the property named PopupMenu, and a listbox will appear with the names of the available Menus - choose the Popup name you want

element.name: TPopupMenu.DoPopup
element.short: DoPopup perform the popup method

element.name: TPopupMenu.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TPopupMenu: calls inherited Create, sets style to PopupMenu, sets AutoPopup to True

element.name: TPopupMenu.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TPopupMenu: closes window then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TPopupMenu.PopUp
element.short: PopUp - sofware emulation of the OnPopup event

element.name: TPopupMenu.PopupComponent
element.short: PopupComponent - the Component to which this popup applies

element.name: TPopupMenu.PopupPoint
element.short: PopupPoint - the position at which the Popup is to appear

element.name: TPopupMenu.Close
element.short: Close - software emulation of the OnClose event, to shut down the Popup

element.name: TPopupMenu.DoClose
element.short: DoClose - perform the Close method

element.name: TPopupMenu.AutoPopup
element.short: AutoPopup - if True, the Popup window automatically appears when the mouse hovers over the relevant object

element.name: TPopupMenu.OnPopup
element.short: OnPopup - event handler for a requirement for a popup menu

element.name: TPopupMenu.OnClose
element.short: OnClose - event handler for closing down the popup
element.descr: You can delete menu items here. But if you delete the clicked menu item on OnClose the OnClick will not follow under Windows.

topic.name: HowToUseMenus
topic.short:
HowToUseMenus
- hints for creating Menus for your Forms

descr.p:
HowToUseMenus
- hints for creating Menus for your Forms

TMainMenu
is the Main Menu that appears at the top of most forms; form designers can customise by choosing various menu items. TPopupMenu is a menu window that pops up with pertinent, usually context-sensitive, details and choices when the right mouse button is clicked near a control

Main Menu is a non-visible component : that is, if the icon is selected from the Component Palette and placed on the Form, it will not appear at Run-time. Instead, a Menu bar with a structure defined by the Menu Editor will appear. Popup menus, placed on the form by selecting the icon from the Component Palette, do not appear at all unless the right mouse button is clicked on a control that owns such a menu.
To see the Menu Editor, right-click on the Main Menu or Popup Menu icon on your Form. A pop-up box appears, that invites you to enter items into the Menu bar.

An Edit box is displayed, containing a Button labelled New Item1. If you right-click on that box, a pop-up menu is displayed that allows you to add a new item before or after (along the same level) or create a sub-menu with the opportunity to add further items below (or above) the new item in a downward column.
Any or all of the MenuItems that you add can be configured using the Object Inspector.

At the least you should give each item a Caption which will appear on the Menu Bar (you may also wish to give it a more meaningful Name). The caption should indicate the activity to be selected, such as "File Open" or "Close", "Run" or "Quit"

If you want a particular letter in the Caption to be associated with a shortcut key, that letter should be preceded by an ampersand. The Menu item at run-time will appear with the shortcut letter underlined, and hitting that letter key will have the same effect as selecting the menu item. Alternatively you can choose a shortcut key sequence (such as Ctrl-C for Copy or Ctrl-V for Paste - the standard Keyboard shortcuts) with the ShortCut property of the MenuItem.

It is often helpful to use the Menu controls in conjuction with an ActionList which contains a series of standard or customised Actions. Menu Items can be linked in the Object Inspector to Actions on the list, and the same actions can be linked to Buttons, ToolBar Buttons, SpeedButtons etc. It is obviously economic of effort to re-use the same code to respond to the various events, rather than writing separate OnClick event handlers for each individual control.

By default a number of standard actions is pre-loaded from StdActns or, if DataAware controls are being used, from DBActns, and these can be chosen using the ActionList editor which appears when you right-click on the ActionList icon on the Form Designer.

element.name: TMenuItem.BitmapChange
element.short: BitmapChange - update the image associated with the menu item when the Bitmap has been changed

element.name: TMenuItem.UpdateImage
element.short: UpdateImage - freshen the image associated with the menu item, particularly if it has changed

element.name: TMenuItem.UpdateWSIcon
element.short: UpdateWSIcon - update the icon in the current Widget Set for this menu item

element.name: TMenuItem.Find
element.short: Find the identity given menu item (named in ACaption)

element.name: TMenuItem.GetIsRightToLeft
element.short: GetIsRightToLeft - find the value of the property determining whether right-to-left read/write is enabled

element.name: TMenuItem.IsLine
element.short: IsLine - if true, this item is a line (separator) on the menu

element.name: TMenuItem.Menu
element.short: Menu - the menu to which this item belongs

element.name: TMenuItem.WriteDebugReport
element.short: WriteDebugReport - used in debugging

element.name: TMenuItem.IntfDoSelect
element.short: IntfDoSelect - perform the selection using the interface

element.name: TMenuItem.AddHandlerOnDestroy
element.short: AddHandlerOnDestroy - add a handler for the OnDestroy event

element.name: TMenuItem.RemoveHandlerOnDestroy
element.short: RemoveHandlerOnDestroy - remove a handler for the OnDestroy event

element.name: TMenuItem.AddHandler
element.short: AddHandler - method to add a handler

element.name: TMenuItem.RemoveHandler
element.short: RemoveHandler - method for removing a handler

element.name: TMenuItemClass
element.short: TMenuItemClass - class of TMenuItem

element.name: TMenu.BidiModeChanged
element.short: BidiModeChanged - method for dealing with changed Bi-directional mode

element.name: TMenu.ParentBidiModeChanged
element.short: ParentBidiModeChanged - procedure to deal with a change in the Parent Bi-directional mode

element.name: TMenu.IsShortcut
element.short: IsShortcut - returns True if the specified message key represents a shortcut

element.name: TMenu.UseRightToLeftAlignment
element.short: UseRightToLeftAlignment - returns True if Right-Left alignment is being used

element.name: TMenu.UseRightToLeftReading
element.short: UseRightToLeftReading - returns True if reading from Right to Left

element.name: TMenu.ShortcutHandled
element.short: ShortcutHandled - if True, the shortcut for the menu is properly handled

element.name: TMenu.BidiMode
element.short: BidiMode - whether Bi-directional mode is implemented, allowing use with languages like Arabic or Hebrew

element.name: TMenu.ParentBidiMode
element.short: ParentBidiMode - the BidiMode of the parent

element.name: TMenuItemHandlerType
element.short: TMenuItemHandlerType - enumerated type for menu item handlers
element.descr: Currently has only one member - mihtDestroy

element.name: TPopupMenu.TrackButton
element.short: TrackButton - defines which mouse button(s) are allowed to activate menu items

element.name: TPopupAlignment
element.short: TPopupAlignment - enumerated type to describe the position of popup menu relative to the popup coordinate

descr.pre: paLeft - position popup menu so it left corner is at the popup coordinate paRight - position popup menu menu so it right corner is at the popup corrdinate paCenter - center popup menu around popup corrdinate

element.name: TTrackButton
element.short: TTrackButton - enumerated type described which mouse buttons can be used to activate (click) menu items

descr.pre: tbRightButton - both left and right buttons are used to activate a menu item tbLeftButton - only left button is used to activate a menu item

element.name: TPopupMenu.Alignment
element.short: Alignment - determines the position of popup menu relative to the popup coordinate
